helptips.helptip:
The User's Guide contains a Getting Started section.

Please visit the McIDAS-V Forums for more help.

In McIDAS-V, the process of analyzing and visualizing data takes the following steps:
  1. Choosing a Data Source.
  2. Selecting the field or diagnostic formula to use for the display.
  3. Selecting the type of display (and optionally selecting a range of times).
  4. Creating the display.
You can load in different sources of data through the Data Sources tab in the Data Explorer window.
The Field Selector Tab in the Data Explorer Window shows all of the loaded data sources and allows you to create new displays from the data sources. View this window here.
You can zoom, pan and rotate the display using the mouse and the keyboard. Read more about Zooming, Panning, and Rotating in the User's Guide.
You have control over time animation with the Time Animation Widget.
If you have errors that need to be reported you can view the error message log from the Help->Show Console menu command.
You can save off the current state of the application (i.e., data, displays and settings) with the File->Save Bundle... menu command. Read more about bundles in the User's Guide.
You can save the layout of the main window display as a default that will be used when you start McIDAS-V. Read more about the "default layout" in the User's Guide.

You can make computations using any data you can display in McIDAS-V using the McIDAS-V formula facility that can be accessed in the Field Selector Tab in the Data Explorer Window. Create formulas with the Formula Editor. See also User's Guide section about McIDAS-V formulas.
You can create and edit color tables with the McIDAS-V Color Table Editor. Read about the Color Table Editor and then invoke it with the Tools->Color Table menu command.
You can change application preferences with the Edit->Preferences... menu command. Read the User's Guide section on this topic.
You can add or change the set of background maps and projections of maps. Read the User's Guide section about this topic.
McIDAS-V can use all the satellite data sets listed in Data Formats and Sources.
You can toggle visibility of displays in several ways. See Toggling Visibility for more information.
You can find distance and direction between two points on the earth's surface with the Range and Bearing tool under Display->Add Range and Bearing menu command.
You can add range rings and azimuth lines to any radar display, or over any point on the map, with the Radar Range Rings under Display->Add Range Rings.
You can write subroutines in Jython and use them to make computations on data with the Jython Library Tools->Formulas->Jython Library menu command. Read about Jythons methods in the User's Guide.
You can create separate display windows and tabs using the File->New Display Window(Tab) menu commands.
You can change the properties of the image displayed by right clicking on the image label in the Map Display Window legend.
The Data Explorer accesses and controls the displayed data. To access the Data Explorer select the Window->Show Data Explorer menu command.
You can capture an image or create a movie of the current display by selecting the View->Capture... menu commands. To read more about capturing an image visit the User's Guide section on this topic.
